definition: to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than

sentences.chinese: 編籃子這一行已逐漸衰弱。

sentences.english: She was already being treated for neurasthenia .
sentences.chinese: 她已開始接受神經衰弱的治療。

sentences.english: The strain of the last few days has weakened him considerably .
sentences.chinese: 最近幾天的勞累在很大程度上使他身體衰弱了。

sentences.english: Her weakened body cannot be easily vitalized.
sentences.chinese: 她衰弱的身體不易重新獲得活力。

sentences.english: Or often before you go to sleep in quiet often prone to tinnitus.
sentences.chinese: 在沉默時或臨睡前常便當產生耳鳴，看看神經衰弱藥。

sentences.english: The old woman has been worn away by her recent illness.
sentences.chinese: 由於最近生病，老婦人的身體日趨衰弱。

sentences.english: Great height is hazardous to the weak head.
sentences.chinese: 神經衰弱者身臨高處有危險。

sentences.english: This is one of the measures the treatment of neurasthenia.
sentences.chinese: 這是治療神經衰弱的措施之一。

sentences.english: Nonstate actors, ranging from unofficial governing entities to terrorist organizations, will grow, particularly in weak states.
sentences.chinese: 非國家行爲體將會增多，特別是在國力衰弱的國家。

sentences.english: See at neurasthenic, also see at spending recognizant obstacle gently when.
sentences.chinese: 見於神經衰弱，也見於輕度意識障礙時。

sentences.english: Though weak, she caressed the cat and would not allow me to take him.
sentences.chinese: 雖然她身體衰弱，但她撫摸它，不讓我把貓抱走。

sentences.english: His health slumped after a long illness.
sentences.chinese: 久病之後，他的身體衰弱得很。

sentences.english: It may subsequently become a weak grower and a distinctly biennial cropper.
sentences.chinese: 隨後會引起樹勢衰弱，明顯兩年結一次果。

sentences.english: The virus may cause epidemic polyarthritis which can be extremely debilitating.
sentences.chinese: 病毒可能會導致疫情多發性關節炎，可以非常衰弱。

sentences.english: Personal expertise can not be qualified for positions they bear. 3. Frail incompetent or performance as the C class Di.
sentences.chinese: 身體衰弱，不能勝任工作的，或考績列爲丙等的。

sentences.english: A weak, nerveless fool, devoid of energy and promptitude.
sentences.chinese: 一個衰弱，軟弱無力的笨蛋，缺乏敏捷的活力。

definition: to decline/to fall/to drop/to falter/a decline/recession (in economics)
to decline/to die out/decline and fall
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
to split up/to divide/to break up/fission/schism
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than
